body: Hi Amedeo, You can do it as simple as adding the materials to the library and apply them to surfaces. Just make sure to create the wave.cal file and copy it inside c:\radiance\lib. Here is the results: [](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/mostaphaRoudsari/hydra_1/master/Render_Water_Cube_with_Honeybee/water_cube_IMG_Perspective.PNG) [](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/mostaphaRoudsari/hydra_1/master/Render_Water_Cube_with_Honeybee/Render_Water_Cube_with_Honeybee_GH.png) Check this Hydra for one of the approaches mentioned in the link: ([http://hydrashare.github.io/hydra/viewer?owner=mostaphaRoudsari&amp...;](http://hydrashare.github.io/hydra/viewer?owner=mostaphaRoudsari&fork=hydra_1&id=Render_Water_Cube_with_Honeybee))
